Keywords: Future , Horsemen , X-Men
Real Name: Various
Special Powers
MUTANT CHIMERA: When Cardinal uses the X-Men team ability to heal another character, until your next turn that character's defense value becomes 18. // When another character uses the X-Men team ability to heal Cardinal, this turn his attack and damage values become equal to that character's printed values.
GENETIC PREDISPOSITION FOR NON-VIOLENCE: When a friendly character within line of fire is damaged by an opposing character, give Cardinal an Apocalypse Seed token. // FREE: Roll a d6 and add the number of his Apocalypse Seed tokens. 8+: Remove all action tokens from him, turn him to click #6 and he can't use his traits for the rest of the game.
TERMINAL APOCALYPSE SEED: Colossal Stamina. Cardinal has PROTECTED: Outwit. // At the end of your turn, if Cardinal did not hit this turn deal him 1 unavoidable damage. // FREE: Remove any number of Apocalypse Seed tokens. Until your next turn, modify a combat value +1 for each token removed.

September 22, 2021
Dortmuner
You didn't read all the comments, I guess. The part about hitting click 5 naturally was based on the dial above, which didn't accurately convey that it's a split dial and getting to click 5 "naturally" would result in a KO. That invalidates the idea of getting to the combat side of the dial naturally and delaying cashing in seeds til late dial. You're better off sitting back and collecting as many seeds as possible before rolling the d6 and going to click 6.
September 22, 2021
BillyBatson19
[QUOTE=Dortmuner;12101820]You're only getting seed tokens when a friendly takes damage, so it's minimum two friendlies damaged (and even then only those in line of fire) to get enough tokens to have a chance to roll an 8, and then you need to roll a 6 on the die. And you only get seed tokens for friendlies getting damaged. You add the number of seed tokens to the d6 roll to get you to 8, but you don't get seed tokens for the d6 roll. (i.e. If you roll a d6 and get a 6 and add two seed tokens to get 8, you still have 2 seed tokens after you turn to click 6, not 8.) So, yes, if you want to go after someone with a 14 attack, it will be at the expense of three damaged friendlies. Attack with 14 twice in a row and you will have needed friendlies to have been damaged 6 times. Plus, once you turn to click 6 through the trait, you cannot use traits anymore for the rest of the game, so even if you bring him back through Krakoan Revival, he can't get any more seed tokens the rest of the game. You might try to optimize your seed token economy by forcing Cardinal to get 1 click of damage each turn. Cardinal himself is a friendly character within line of fire, so when he takes damage from an opposing character, he gets a seed token. Perplex his damage up 1 and have him attack mystic characters to get one point damage. Or tie him up with a poison pog that isn't likely to hit him otherwise (or Chamber, who cannot attack unless you attack someone on his team or he's the only opposing character). You want him on click 6 anyway in this scenario, so taking the damage is getting what you want without actually paying for it. I think you're better off sitting on seeds the whole time, delaying it as long as possible and collecting as many as possible from friendly characters getting damaged. Then hit click 5 naturally, go into combat mode, and when you get to click 8 or 9, roll the d6 and return back to click #6 for essentially a 12 or 13 click dial with some really high combat values at the end. (That's assuming the FREE is optional. If it isn't and you have to roll the d6 every time, you're probably still better off playing naturally instead of forcing the offensive clicks early.) A four click dial of perplex or prob support and then seven or eight clicks of offense that includes 2-3 attacks with +3 to damage or attack is pretty good for 50 points.[/QUOTE] Can you explain how this works? I've been racking my brain trying to understand what you mean about amassing tokens and going to click 5 naturally. With Krakoan Revival can you choose to bring Cardinal back on click 6? Otherwise, I'm not sure I understand how you would pull this off.

Dortmuner

Cause that should cut it down to an average of 3 turns without any damage. I might be playing it wrong, though.[/QUOTE] You're only getting seed tokens when a friendly takes damage, so it's minimum two friendlies damaged (and even then only those in line of fire) to get enough tokens to have a chance to roll an 8, and then you need to roll a 6 on the die. And you only get seed tokens for friendlies getting damaged. You add the number of seed tokens to the d6 roll to get you to 8, but you don't get seed tokens for the d6 roll. (i.e. If you roll a d6 and get a 6 and add two seed tokens to get 8, you still have 2 seed tokens after you turn to click 6, not 8.) So, yes, if you want to go after someone with a 14 attack, it will be at the expense of three damaged friendlies. Attack with 14 twice in a row and you will have needed friendlies to have been damaged 6 times. Plus, once you turn to click 6 through the trait, you cannot use traits anymore for the rest of the game, so even if you bring him back through Krakoan Revival, he can't get any more seed tokens the rest of the game. You might try to optimize your seed token economy by forcing Cardinal to get 1 click of damage each turn. Cardinal himself is a friendly character within line of fire, so when he takes damage from an opposing character, he gets a seed token. Perplex his damage up 1 and have him attack mystic characters to get one point damage. Or tie him up with a poison pog that isn't likely to hit him otherwise (or Chamber, who cannot attack unless you attack someone on his team or he's the only opposing character). You want him on click 6 anyway in this scenario, so taking the damage is getting what you want without actually paying for it. I think you're better off sitting on seeds the whole time, delaying it as long as possible and collecting as many as possible from friendly characters getting damaged. Then hit click 5 naturally, go into combat mode, and when you get to click 8 or 9, roll the d6 and return back to click #6 for essentially a 12 or 13 click dial with some really high combat values at the end. (That's assuming the FREE is optional. If it isn't and you have to roll the d6 every time, you're probably still better off playing naturally instead of forcing the offensive clicks early.) A four click dial of perplex or prob support and then seven or eight clicks of offense that includes 2-3 attacks with +3 to damage or attack is pretty good for 50 points.
January 12, 2021
Phoenix_Icewing
Just to clarify after reading, it says to remove any number of tokens, then to increase a single (a) combat value by that many. So 14 attack or 6 damage, not both (although since a lot of the +2 perplexes dont work on damage, good to have the option). And while he can either perplex or PC, he shouldnt be in the front line, instead where can see everyone- racking up tokens as your team gets roughed up, and hes ignorable until he has 4 ish tokens, giving him some added protection. So you can push him to heal or just push to switch powers, and next turn try that free action to become a blitz turn. The problem is, in a set like this, is that worth 50 points?
January 11, 2021
fastcat99
Oh, man he's chancey. Once he gets going, you're really pressed to try to hit someone, (you'd have to take a click anyway) but if you miss, he takes 2 clicks. But personally, I like having at least one character with that kind of 'no consequence' role. If I sit on him, he dies, but if I go all out, it could be really good for me! Glad I have him. But my only question is, is he generic? Name says 'various' so I'm guessing yes. I'd love to play several on a team.
